application-versions.name: Microsoft Clustered SharePoint Server 2010
application-versions.description:
Test: Random name of DB prefix. Enterprise Version of SharePoint Server 2010 to demonstrate how to set up a multi-server SharePoint farm. The setup of this version of Sharepoint Server 2010 takes advantage of the AutoSPInstaller code for Sharepoint Server 2010 installation (http://autospinstaller.codeplex.com). With its help, we have a fully automated setup for Clustered Sharepoint Server 2010.
For detailed description of this implementation and prerequisites, please see the documentation.

application.name: Microsoft Clustered SharePoint Server 2010
application.description: Enterprise Version of SharePoint Server 2010 to demonstrate how to set up a multi-server SharePoint farm.

ns7:component-version-script.script:
# - Add SP Install to the local administration group # - Turn off UAC setting. If necessary, feel free to turn it on by # adding a task at the end of deployment during Deployment Profile # Editing at Execution Plan phase. # - Extact AutoSPInstaller package and ShellPoint 2010 installler package # - Copy PsExec to the location of AutoSPInstaller bin folder # - Copy adobe pdf files to AutoSPInstaller install folder # - Copy the prerequisite installer files for SharePoint Server installation to the bin folder # # Required props: # - sp_install_acct # - sp_install_root # - unzip_command # - sp_download_location # - sp_predownload_location # - autoSPInstaller_file # - sp_installer_file # - psexec_url # - adobe_pdf_iFiler_url # - adobe_pdf_icon_url ####################################################################
# PROPERTIES $sp_install_location="$sp_install_root\SP" $sp_sharepoint_files_location="$sp_install_location\SharePoint" $sp_install_bin="$sp_install_location\AutoSPInstaller"
# VALIDATION FUNCTIONS Function check_error { if ($error.count -gt 0) { error_exit $args[0] } }
Function error_exit { echo $args[0] exit 1 }
Function DeleteDir([string]$dirName) { If (Test-Path "$dirName" -Verbose) { Remove-Item -Recurse -Force $dirName } }
## Add SP Install to local admin group net localgroup administrators $sp_install_acct /add
## Turn of UAC setting. Reboot is needed. C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe /k %windir%\System32\reg.exe ADD HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System /v EnableLUA /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f
## Set Execution Policy. User can always to reset it by adding a script task at the end of the task flow during Deployment Profile editing at Execution Plan phase. Set-ExecutionPolicy remoteSigned -force
## Extract files from AutoSPInstaller package Write-Output "Extract files for AutoSPInstaller" # Delete the SP install location if exists. We will do a fresh install. DeleteDir $sp_install_location cd "$sp_install_root" cmd /C "$unzip_command $sp_download_location\$autoSPInstaller_file" Write-Output "Finished Extracting files for AutoSPInstaller"
## Extract files from Sharepoint installer $sp_sharepoint_extract_temp="C:\SP_Temp" $pinfo = New-Object System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo $pinfo.FileName = "$sp_download_location\$sp_installer_file" $pinfo.RedirectStandardError = $true $pinfo.RedirectStandardOutput = $true $pinfo.UseShellExecute = $false $pinfo.Arguments = "/extract:$sp_sharepoint_extract_temp /quiet" $p = New-Object System.Diagnostics.Process $p.StartInfo = $pinfo Write-output "Start extract Sharepoint installer..." $p.Start() | Out-Null $p.WaitForExit() If($p.ExitCode -ne 0) { error_exit "Error: extract $sp_installer_file" }
## Copy the extracted SP installer to $sp_sharepoint_files_location Write-Output "Copy the extracted SP files to $sp_sharepoint_files_location" Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_sharepoint_extract_temp\*" -Destination "$sp_sharepoint_files_location" Remove-Item -Recurse -Force "$sp_sharepoint_extract_temp" Write-output "Finished extract SharePoint installer."
# COPY PSEXEC PACKAGE TO AUTOSPINSTALLER BIN FOLDER $psexec_file=$psexec_url.Split('/')[-1] Write-Output "Copy the PsExec package to $sp_install_bin." Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_download_location\$psexec_file" -Destination "$sp_install_bin" check_error "ERROR:WHILE COPYING THE PSEXEC PACKAGE TO $sp_install_bin." Write-output "Finished copying the PsExec package to $sp_install_bin."
# COPY ADOBE PACKAGE TO SP INSTALL ROOT $pdf_file=$adobe_pdf_iFiler_url.Split('/')[-1] $icon_file=$adobe_pdf_icon_url.Split('/')[-1] Write-Output "Copy adobe package to SP installer root..." Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_download_location\$pdf_file" -Destination "$sp_install_location\PDF" Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_download_location\$icon_file" -Destination "$sp_install_location\PDF" Write-Output "Done."
# Copy the prerequisite installer files for SharePoint Server installation to the bin folder Write-Output "Copy prerequisite installer files for SharePoint Server installation to $sp_sharepoint_files_location\PrerequisiteInstallerFiles..." Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_predownload_location\PrerequisiteInstallerFiles\*" -Destination "$sp_sharepoint_files_location\PrerequisiteInstallerFiles" Write-Output "Done."

ns7:component-version-script.script:
# - Configure AutoSPInstaller.xml # - Configure Sharepoint config.xml and OWA xml # # Required properties: # - domain_account # - domain_password # - sp_install_root # - sp_download_location # - sp_cust_autoSPInstaller_xml # - db_instance # - db_port # - db_prefix # - sp_admin_host # - sp_admin_cluster_hosts # - sp_appserver_cluster_hosts # - portal_app_port # - user_full_domain: for example, "domain.com" ##################################################################
$sp_install_location="$sp_install_root\SP" $sp_script_location="$sp_install_location\AutoSPInstaller" $sp_config_xml="$sp_script_location\config.xml" $sp_config_owa_xml="$sp_script_location\config-OWA.xml" $sp_script_xml="$sp_script_location\AutoSPInstallerInput.xml"
# $user_full_domain needs to be in the domain full name, for example, "domain.com" $computer_name="$ENV:COMPUTERNAME" $user_domain="$user_full_domain" $sp_admin=$sp_admin_host $unique_db_prefix="$db_prefix" $wfe_cluster=Write-Output ($sp_wfe_cluster_hosts -join ' ') # Note: For now, only one app server works with the scripts. More code to be continued. $first_node_app_server=Write-Output ($sp_appserver_cluster_hosts -join ' ')
# domain name and user name $domain,$domain_username = $domain_account -Split "\\"
#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- # The following will configure AutoSPInstallerInput.xml, which is the central configuration # file to configure the whole SharePoint Server cluster installation. # # The following are the default values for the properties in AutoSPInstallerInput.xml. # If you follow the setup instruction for the installation, you don't need to change anything # below; Otherwise feel free to make any modification. # # There are some key props which are already exposed on the servcie property list. # The following can be optionally push to there too according to the requirements #--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# passphrase for joining the existing farm. $passphrase="vmware123#" # Default password for all installation accounts. Modify it if your setup is differenct. $install_account_allInOne_password="$allInOne_password"
# Installation accounts for SharePoint Server cluster installation $sp_install="$domain\SP_Install" $sp_farm="$domain\SP_Farm " $sp_portalAppPool="$domain\SP_PortalAppPool" $sp_ProfilesAppPool="$domain\SP_ProfilesAppPool" $sp_services="$domain\SP_Services" $sp_searchService="$domain\SP_SearchService" $sp_SearchContent="$domain\SP_SearchContent" $sp_ProfileSync="$domain\SP_ProfileSync" $sp_cacheSuperUser="$sp_services" $sp_cacheSuperReader="$sp_services"
$sp_install_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_farm_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_portalAppPool_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_ProfilesAppPool_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_services_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_searchService_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_SearchContent_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_ProfileSync_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_cacheSuperUser_pd="$sp_services_pd" $sp_cacheSuperReader_pd="$sp_services_pd"
# Properties for Services section configures the core service instances & components that # are part of SharePoint Foundation $smtp_server="smtp.sample.com" $email_address="nobody@sample.com" $reply_to_email="nobody@sample.com" #--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# HELP FUNCTIONS Function CreateDir([string]$dirName) { If (!(Test-Path "$dirName" -Verbose)) { Write-Output "create download directory $dirName" New-Item -ItemType Directory $dirName -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } }
Function DeleteAndCreateFile([string]$filePath) { If (Test-Path "$filePath" -Verbose) { Remove-Item -Force $filePath }
$path = split-path $filePath -Parent $fileName = split-path $filePath -Leaf
CreateDir $path
write-Output "create download directory $fileName" New-Item -ItemType File $filePath -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }
Set-ExecutionPolicy remoteSigned -Force
## GENERATE CONFIG FILE FOR SHAREPOINT SETUP DeleteAndCreateFile $sp_config_xml DeleteAndCreateFile $sp_config_owa_xml Write-Output "Compose config.xml for Sharepoint setup" add-content $sp_config_xml "<Configuration>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Package Id=`"sts`">" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"LAUNCHEDFROMSETUPSTS`" Value=`"Yes`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " </Package>" add-content $sp_config_xml "" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Package Id=`"spswfe`">" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUPCALLED`" Value=`"1`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"OFFICESERVERPREMIUM`" Value=`"1`" />" add-content $sp_config_xml " </Package>" add-content $sp_config_xml "" add-content $sp_config_xml " <ARP ARPCOMMENTS=`"Installed with AutoSPInstaller (http://autospinstaller.com)`" ARPCONTACT=`"brian@autospinstaller.com`" />" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Logging Type=`"verbose`" Path=`"%temp%`" Template=`"SharePoint Server Setup(*).log`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Display Level=`"basic`" CompletionNotice=`"No`" AcceptEula=`"Yes`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <INSTALLLOCATION Value=`"%PROGRAMFILES%\Microsoft Office Servers\`" />" add-content $sp_config_xml " <PIDKEY Value=`"$pidkey`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"SERVERROLE`" Value=`"APPLICATION`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"USINGUIINSTALLMODE`" Value=`"1`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUPTYPE`" Value=`"CLEAN_INSTALL`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUP_REBOOT`" Value=`"Never`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"AllowWindowsClientInstall`" Value=`"True`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml "</Configuration>" Write-Output "Finished config.xml for Sharepoint setup"
Write-Output "Compose config-OWA.xml for Sharepoint setup" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml "<Configuration>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Package Id=`"sts`">" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"LAUNCHEDFROMSETUPSTS`" Value=`"Yes`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " </Package>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml "" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Logging Type=`"verbose`" Path=`"%temp%`" Template=`"Wac Server Setup(*).log`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Display Level=`"basic`" CompletionNotice=`"no`" />" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"SERVERROLE`" Value=`"APPLICATION`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <PIDKEY Value=`"$pidkey`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"USINGUIINSTALLMODE`" Value=`"1`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUPTYPE`" Value=`"CLEAN_INSTALL`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUP_REBOOT`" Value=`"Never`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"AllowWindowsClientInstall`" Value=`"True`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml "</Configuration>" Write-Output "Finished config-OWA.xml for Sharepoint setup"
Write-Output "Start to compose the SP installation configuration xml file" [xml]$xmlInput=(Get-Content $sp_script_xml)
# Configure Install options $xmlInput.Configuration.Install.OfflineInstall="true" $xmlInput.Configuration.Install.AutoAdminLogon.Enable="true" $xmlInput.Configuration.Install.AutoAdminLogon.Password="$admin_password" $xmlInput.Configuration.Install.Disable.LoopbackCheck="false"
# Write install-central-admin to admin server $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.PassPhrase="$passphrase" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.CentralAdmin.Provision="$sp_admin $wfe_cluster" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.CentralAdmin.Database="AdminContent-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.CentralAdmin.Port="$sp_admin_port"
# and set the VMs that Central Admin, web apps, and web servers will be installed to Write-Output "Set DB instance information." $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Database.DBServer="SP2010CLUSTERDB-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Database.DBAlias.DBInstance="$db_instance" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Database.DBAlias.DBPort="$db_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Database.DBPrefix="$unique_db_prefix"
# Configure Services section configures the core service instances & components that are part of SharePoint Foundation. # Installing STMP and configuration of email service is off. You can turn them on if desired $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Services.SMTP.Install="false" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Services.OutgoingEmail.SMTPServer="$smtp_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Services.OutgoingEmail.EmailAddress="$email_address" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Services.OutgoingEmail.ReplyToEmail="$reply_to_email"
# Configure WebApplications session $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.AddURLsToHOSTS="false" # Web application "portal" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].url="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].port="$portal_app_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].databaseName="PortalDB-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].applicationPoolAccount="$sp_portalAppPool" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.owner="$sp_portalAppPool" if( "$portal_app_port" -eq "80" ) { $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.siteUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.SearchUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain/search" } else { $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.siteUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain"+":"+"$web_app_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.SearchUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain"+":"+"$web_app_port/search" }
# Web application "mySiteHost" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].url="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].port="$web_app_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].name="MySiteHost-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].databaseName="MySiteHostDB-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.name="MySiteHost-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].applicationPoolAccount="$sp_ProfilesAppPool" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.owner="$sp_ProfilesAppPool" if( "$web_app_port" -eq "80" ) { $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.siteUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.SearchUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain/search" } else { $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.siteUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain"+":"+"$web_app_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.SearchUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain"+":"+"$web_app_port/search" }
# Configure ServiceApps session $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.ManagedMetadataServiceApp.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.UserProfileServiceApp.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.CrawlServers.Server.Name="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.QueryServers.Server.Name="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.SearchQueryAndSiteSettingsServers.Server.Name="$first_node_app_server" # Note: You can only run the AdminComponent on one server per Search Service App, so only list one server here $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.AdminComponent.Server.Name="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.AdminComponent.ApplicationPool.Account="$sp_searchService" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.DatabaseName="Search-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.StateService.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.WebAnalyticsService.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.SPUsageService.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.SecureStoreService.Provision="$first_node_app_server"
# Configure installation accounts in the configuration file $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Account.Username="$sp_install" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Account.Password="$sp_install_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[0].CommonName="spservice" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[0].Username="$sp_services" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[0].Password="$sp_services_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[1].CommonName="portalapppool" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[1].Username="$sp_portalAppPool" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[1].Password="$sp_portalAppPool_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[2].CommonName="mysiteapppool" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[2].Username="$sp_ProfilesAppPool" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[2].Password="$sp_ProfilesAppPool_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[3].CommonName="searchservice" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[3].Username="$sp_searchService" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[3].Password="$sp_searchService_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ObjectCacheAccounts.SuperUser="$sp_cacheSuperUser" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ObjectCacheAccounts.SuperReader="$sp_cacheSuperReader"
$xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.UserProfileServiceApp.SyncConnectionAccount="$sp_ProfileSync" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.UserProfileServiceApp.SyncConnectionAccountPassword="$sp_ProfileSync_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.Account="$sp_searchService" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.Password="$sp_searchService_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.ContentAccessAccount="$sp_SearchContent" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.ContentAccessAccountPassword="$sp_SearchContent_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.ApplicationPool.Account="$sp_SearchContent" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.ApplicationPool.Password="$sp_SearchContent_pd"
# Done all the modification in the configuration file. Save it. $sp_script_xmlfile=Get-Item "$sp_script_xml" if ($sp_script_xmlfile.IsReadOnly -eq $true) { # take off ReadOnly mode $sp_script_xmlfile.IsReadOnly=$false $xmlInput.Save($sp_script_xml) # Put back ReadOnly mode $sp_script_xmlfile.IsReadOnly=$true } else { $xmlInput.Save($sp_script_xml) } Write-Output "Customization of xml input file is done."

ns7:component-version-script.script:
# - Add SP Install to the local administration group # - Turn off UAC setting. If necessary, feel free to turn it on by # adding a task at the end of deployment during Deployment Profile # Editing at Execution Plan phase. # - Extact AutoSPInstaller package and ShellPoint 2010 installler package # - Copy PsExec to the location of AutoSPInstaller bin folder # - Copy adobe pdf files to AutoSPInstaller install folder # - Copy the prerequisite installer files for SharePoint Server installation to the bin folder # # Required props: # - sp_install_acct # - sp_install_root # - unzip_command # - sp_download_location # - sp_predownload_location # - autoSPInstaller_file # - sp_installer_file # - psexec_url # - adobe_pdf_iFiler_url # - adobe_pdf_icon_url ####################################################################
# PROPERTIES $sp_install_location="$sp_install_root\SP" $sp_sharepoint_files_location="$sp_install_location\SharePoint" $sp_install_bin="$sp_install_location\AutoSPInstaller"
# VALIDATION FUNCTIONS Function check_error { if ($error.count -gt 0) { error_exit $args[0] } }
Function error_exit { echo $args[0] exit 1 }
Function DeleteDir([string]$dirName) { If (Test-Path "$dirName" -Verbose) { Remove-Item -Recurse -Force $dirName } }
## Add SP Install to local admin group net localgroup administrators $sp_install_acct /add
## Turn of UAC setting. Reboot is needed. C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe /k %windir%\System32\reg.exe ADD HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System /v EnableLUA /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f
## Set Execution Policy. User can always to reset it by adding a script task at the end of the task flow during Deployment Profile editing at Execution Plan phase. Set-ExecutionPolicy remoteSigned -force
## Extract files from AutoSPInstaller package Write-Output "Extract files for AutoSPInstaller" # Delete the SP install location if exists. We will do a fresh install. DeleteDir $sp_install_location cd "$sp_install_root" cmd /C "$unzip_command $sp_download_location\$autoSPInstaller_file" Write-Output "Finished Extracting files for AutoSPInstaller"
## Extract files from Sharepoint installer $sp_sharepoint_extract_temp="C:\SP_Temp" $pinfo = New-Object System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo $pinfo.FileName = "$sp_download_location\$sp_installer_file" $pinfo.RedirectStandardError = $true $pinfo.RedirectStandardOutput = $true $pinfo.UseShellExecute = $false $pinfo.Arguments = "/extract:$sp_sharepoint_extract_temp /quiet" $p = New-Object System.Diagnostics.Process $p.StartInfo = $pinfo Write-output "Start extract Sharepoint installer..." $p.Start() | Out-Null $p.WaitForExit() If($p.ExitCode -ne 0) { error_exit "Error: extract $sp_installer_file" }
## Copy the extracted SP installer to $sp_sharepoint_files_location Write-Output "Copy the extracted SP files to $sp_sharepoint_files_location" Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_sharepoint_extract_temp\*" -Destination "$sp_sharepoint_files_location" Remove-Item -Recurse -Force "$sp_sharepoint_extract_temp" Write-output "Finished extract SharePoint installer."
# COPY PSEXEC PACKAGE TO AUTOSPINSTALLER BIN FOLDER $psexec_file=$psexec_url.Split('/')[-1] Write-Output "Copy the PsExec package to $sp_install_bin." Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_download_location\$psexec_file" -Destination "$sp_install_bin" check_error "ERROR:WHILE COPYING THE PSEXEC PACKAGE TO $sp_install_bin." Write-output "Finished copying the PsExec package to $sp_install_bin."
# COPY ADOBE PACKAGE TO SP INSTALL ROOT $pdf_file=$adobe_pdf_iFiler_url.Split('/')[-1] $icon_file=$adobe_pdf_icon_url.Split('/')[-1] Write-Output "Copy adobe package to SP installer root..." Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_download_location\$pdf_file" -Destination "$sp_install_location\PDF" Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_download_location\$icon_file" -Destination "$sp_install_location\PDF" Write-Output "Done."
# Copy the prerequisite installer files for SharePoint Server installation to the bin folder Write-Output "Copy prerequisite installer files for SharePoint Server installation to $sp_sharepoint_files_location\PrerequisiteInstallerFiles..." Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_predownload_location\PrerequisiteInstallerFiles\*" -Destination "$sp_sharepoint_files_location\PrerequisiteInstallerFiles" Write-Output "Done."

service.description:
Enterprise Version of SharePoint Server 2010 to demonstrate how to set up a multi-server SharePoint farm.
The Prerequisites: - Software: 1. only works with CodePlex.com
Pre-set in the template: - OS: Windows 2008 Server R2 (Enterprise edition) - proxy settings is set if it is needed for the servers to communicate with outside. - Including .exe files to low file types is preset in the template to turn off warning for the installation.

ns7:component-version-script.script:
# - Configure AutoSPInstaller.xml # - Configure Sharepoint config.xml and OWA xml # # Required properties: # - domain_account # - domain_password # - sp_install_root # - sp_download_location # - sp_cust_autoSPInstaller_xml # - db_instance # - db_port # - db_prefix # - sp_admin_host # - sp_admin_cluster_hosts # - sp_appserver_cluster_hosts # - portal_app_port # - user_full_domain: for example, "domain.com" ##################################################################
$sp_install_location="$sp_install_root\SP" $sp_script_location="$sp_install_location\AutoSPInstaller" $sp_config_xml="$sp_script_location\config.xml" $sp_config_owa_xml="$sp_script_location\config-OWA.xml" $sp_script_xml="$sp_script_location\AutoSPInstallerInput.xml"
# $user_full_domain needs to be in the domain full name, for example, "domain.com" $computer_name="$ENV:COMPUTERNAME" $user_domain="$user_full_domain" $sp_admin=$sp_admin_host $unique_db_prefix="$db_prefix" $wfe_cluster=Write-Output ($sp_wfe_cluster_hosts -join ' ') # Note: For now, only one app server works with the scripts. More code to be continued. $first_node_app_server=Write-Output ($sp_appserver_cluster_hosts -join ' ')
# domain name and user name $domain,$domain_username = $domain_account -Split "\\"
#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- # The following will configure AutoSPInstallerInput.xml, which is the central configuration # file to configure the whole SharePoint Server cluster installation. # # The following are the default values for the properties in AutoSPInstallerInput.xml. # If you follow the setup instruction for the installation, you don't need to change anything # below; Otherwise feel free to make any modification. # # There are some key props which are already exposed on the servcie property list. # The following can be optionally push to there too according to the requirements #--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# passphrase for joining the existing farm. $passphrase="vmware123#" # Default password for all installation accounts. Modify it if your setup is differenct. $install_account_allInOne_password="$allInOne_password"
# Installation accounts for SharePoint Server cluster installation $sp_install="$domain\SP_Install" $sp_farm="$domain\SP_Farm " $sp_portalAppPool="$domain\SP_PortalAppPool" $sp_ProfilesAppPool="$domain\SP_ProfilesAppPool" $sp_services="$domain\SP_Services" $sp_searchService="$domain\SP_SearchService" $sp_SearchContent="$domain\SP_SearchContent" $sp_ProfileSync="$domain\SP_ProfileSync" $sp_cacheSuperUser="$sp_services" $sp_cacheSuperReader="$sp_services"
$sp_install_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_farm_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_portalAppPool_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_ProfilesAppPool_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_services_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_searchService_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_SearchContent_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_ProfileSync_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_cacheSuperUser_pd="$sp_services_pd" $sp_cacheSuperReader_pd="$sp_services_pd"
# Properties for Services section configures the core service instances & components that # are part of SharePoint Foundation $smtp_server="smtp.sample.com" $email_address="nobody@sample.com" $reply_to_email="nobody@sample.com" #--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# HELP FUNCTIONS Function CreateDir([string]$dirName) { If (!(Test-Path "$dirName" -Verbose)) { Write-Output "create download directory $dirName" New-Item -ItemType Directory $dirName -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } }
Function DeleteAndCreateFile([string]$filePath) { If (Test-Path "$filePath" -Verbose) { Remove-Item -Force $filePath }
$path = split-path $filePath -Parent $fileName = split-path $filePath -Leaf
CreateDir $path
write-Output "create download directory $fileName" New-Item -ItemType File $filePath -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }
Set-ExecutionPolicy remoteSigned -Force
## GENERATE CONFIG FILE FOR SHAREPOINT SETUP DeleteAndCreateFile $sp_config_xml DeleteAndCreateFile $sp_config_owa_xml Write-Output "Compose config.xml for Sharepoint setup" add-content $sp_config_xml "<Configuration>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Package Id=`"sts`">" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"LAUNCHEDFROMSETUPSTS`" Value=`"Yes`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " </Package>" add-content $sp_config_xml "" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Package Id=`"spswfe`">" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUPCALLED`" Value=`"1`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"OFFICESERVERPREMIUM`" Value=`"1`" />" add-content $sp_config_xml " </Package>" add-content $sp_config_xml "" add-content $sp_config_xml " <ARP ARPCOMMENTS=`"Installed with AutoSPInstaller (http://autospinstaller.com)`" ARPCONTACT=`"brian@autospinstaller.com`" />" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Logging Type=`"verbose`" Path=`"%temp%`" Template=`"SharePoint Server Setup(*).log`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Display Level=`"basic`" CompletionNotice=`"No`" AcceptEula=`"Yes`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <INSTALLLOCATION Value=`"%PROGRAMFILES%\Microsoft Office Servers\`" />" add-content $sp_config_xml " <PIDKEY Value=`"$pidkey`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"SERVERROLE`" Value=`"APPLICATION`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"USINGUIINSTALLMODE`" Value=`"1`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUPTYPE`" Value=`"CLEAN_INSTALL`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUP_REBOOT`" Value=`"Never`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"AllowWindowsClientInstall`" Value=`"True`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml "</Configuration>" Write-Output "Finished config.xml for Sharepoint setup"
Write-Output "Compose config-OWA.xml for Sharepoint setup" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml "<Configuration>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Package Id=`"sts`">" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"LAUNCHEDFROMSETUPSTS`" Value=`"Yes`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " </Package>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml "" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Logging Type=`"verbose`" Path=`"%temp%`" Template=`"Wac Server Setup(*).log`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Display Level=`"basic`" CompletionNotice=`"no`" />" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"SERVERROLE`" Value=`"APPLICATION`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <PIDKEY Value=`"$pidkey`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"USINGUIINSTALLMODE`" Value=`"1`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUPTYPE`" Value=`"CLEAN_INSTALL`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUP_REBOOT`" Value=`"Never`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"AllowWindowsClientInstall`" Value=`"True`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml "</Configuration>" Write-Output "Finished config-OWA.xml for Sharepoint setup"
Write-Output "Start to compose the SP installation configuration xml file" [xml]$xmlInput=(Get-Content $sp_script_xml)
# Configure Install options $xmlInput.Configuration.Install.OfflineInstall="true" $xmlInput.Configuration.Install.AutoAdminLogon.Enable="true" $xmlInput.Configuration.Install.AutoAdminLogon.Password="$admin_password" $xmlInput.Configuration.Install.Disable.LoopbackCheck="false"
# Write install-central-admin to admin server $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.PassPhrase="$passphrase" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.CentralAdmin.Provision="$sp_admin $wfe_cluster" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.CentralAdmin.Database="AdminContent-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.CentralAdmin.Port="$sp_admin_port"
# and set the VMs that Central Admin, web apps, and web servers will be installed to Write-Output "Set DB instance information." $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Database.DBServer="SP2010CLUSTERDB-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Database.DBAlias.DBInstance="$db_instance" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Database.DBAlias.DBPort="$db_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Database.DBPrefix="$unique_db_prefix"
# Configure Services section configures the core service instances & components that are part of SharePoint Foundation. # Installing STMP and configuration of email service is off. You can turn them on if desired $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Services.SMTP.Install="false" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Services.OutgoingEmail.SMTPServer="$smtp_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Services.OutgoingEmail.EmailAddress="$email_address" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Services.OutgoingEmail.ReplyToEmail="$reply_to_email"
# Configure WebApplications session $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.AddURLsToHOSTS="false" # Web application "portal" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].url="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].port="$portal_app_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].databaseName="PortalDB-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].applicationPoolAccount="$sp_portalAppPool" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.owner="$sp_portalAppPool" if( "$portal_app_port" -eq "80" ) { $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.siteUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.SearchUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain/search" } else { $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.siteUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain"+":"+"$web_app_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.SearchUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain"+":"+"$web_app_port/search" }
# Web application "mySiteHost" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].url="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].port="$web_app_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].name="MySiteHost-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].databaseName="MySiteHostDB-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.name="MySiteHost-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].applicationPoolAccount="$sp_ProfilesAppPool" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.owner="$sp_ProfilesAppPool" if( "$web_app_port" -eq "80" ) { $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.siteUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.SearchUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain/search" } else { $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.siteUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain"+":"+"$web_app_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.SearchUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain"+":"+"$web_app_port/search" }
# Configure ServiceApps session $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.ManagedMetadataServiceApp.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.UserProfileServiceApp.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.CrawlServers.Server.Name="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.QueryServers.Server.Name="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.SearchQueryAndSiteSettingsServers.Server.Name="$first_node_app_server" # Note: You can only run the AdminComponent on one server per Search Service App, so only list one server here $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.AdminComponent.Server.Name="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.AdminComponent.ApplicationPool.Account="$sp_searchService" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.DatabaseName="Search-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.StateService.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.WebAnalyticsService.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.SPUsageService.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.SecureStoreService.Provision="$first_node_app_server"
# Configure installation accounts in the configuration file $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Account.Username="$sp_install" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Account.Password="$sp_install_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[0].CommonName="spservice" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[0].Username="$sp_services" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[0].Password="$sp_services_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[1].CommonName="portalapppool" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[1].Username="$sp_portalAppPool" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[1].Password="$sp_portalAppPool_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[2].CommonName="mysiteapppool" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[2].Username="$sp_ProfilesAppPool" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[2].Password="$sp_ProfilesAppPool_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[3].CommonName="searchservice" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[3].Username="$sp_searchService" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[3].Password="$sp_searchService_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ObjectCacheAccounts.SuperUser="$sp_cacheSuperUser" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ObjectCacheAccounts.SuperReader="$sp_cacheSuperReader"
$xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.UserProfileServiceApp.SyncConnectionAccount="$sp_ProfileSync" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.UserProfileServiceApp.SyncConnectionAccountPassword="$sp_ProfileSync_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.Account="$sp_searchService" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.Password="$sp_searchService_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.ContentAccessAccount="$sp_SearchContent" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.ContentAccessAccountPassword="$sp_SearchContent_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.ApplicationPool.Account="$sp_SearchContent" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.ApplicationPool.Password="$sp_SearchContent_pd"
# Done all the modification in the configuration file. Save it. $sp_script_xmlfile=Get-Item "$sp_script_xml" if ($sp_script_xmlfile.IsReadOnly -eq $true) { # take off ReadOnly mode $sp_script_xmlfile.IsReadOnly=$false $xmlInput.Save($sp_script_xml) # Put back ReadOnly mode $sp_script_xmlfile.IsReadOnly=$true } else { $xmlInput.Save($sp_script_xml) } Write-Output "Customization of xml input file is done."

This is Required Service for "Microsoft Clustered SharePoint Server 2010" service. It prepares all the prerequisites for it.
This service needs to pair with "Microsoft Clustered SharePoint Server 2010" service, which should have a depends-one relationship to this service. See the sample application "Microsoft Clustered SharePoint Server 2010" for its usage.

ns7:component-version-script.script:
# - Add SP Install to the local administration group # - Turn off UAC setting. If necessary, feel free to turn it on by # adding a task at the end of deployment during Deployment Profile # Editing at Execution Plan phase. # - Extact AutoSPInstaller package and ShellPoint 2010 installler package # - Copy PsExec to the location of AutoSPInstaller bin folder # - Copy adobe pdf files to AutoSPInstaller install folder # - Copy the prerequisite installer files for SharePoint Server installation to the bin folder # # Required props: # - sp_install_acct # - sp_install_root # - unzip_command # - sp_download_location # - sp_predownload_location # - autoSPInstaller_file # - sp_installer_file # - psexec_url # - adobe_pdf_iFiler_url # - adobe_pdf_icon_url ####################################################################
# PROPERTIES $sp_install_location="$sp_install_root\SP" $sp_sharepoint_files_location="$sp_install_location\SharePoint" $sp_install_bin="$sp_install_location\AutoSPInstaller"
# VALIDATION FUNCTIONS Function check_error { if ($error.count -gt 0) { error_exit $args[0] } }
Function error_exit { echo $args[0] exit 1 }
Function DeleteDir([string]$dirName) { If (Test-Path "$dirName" -Verbose) { Remove-Item -Recurse -Force $dirName } }
## Add SP Install to local admin group net localgroup administrators $sp_install_acct /add
## Turn of UAC setting. Reboot is needed. C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe /k %windir%\System32\reg.exe ADD HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System /v EnableLUA /t REG_DWORD /d 0 /f
## Set Execution Policy. User can always to reset it by adding a script task at the end of the task flow during Deployment Profile editing at Execution Plan phase. Set-ExecutionPolicy remoteSigned -force
## Extract files from AutoSPInstaller package Write-Output "Extract files for AutoSPInstaller" # Delete the SP install location if exists. We will do a fresh install. DeleteDir $sp_install_location cd "$sp_install_root" cmd /C "$unzip_command $sp_download_location\$autoSPInstaller_file" Write-Output "Finished Extracting files for AutoSPInstaller"
## Extract files from Sharepoint installer $sp_sharepoint_extract_temp="C:\SP_Temp" $pinfo = New-Object System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo $pinfo.FileName = "$sp_download_location\$sp_installer_file" $pinfo.RedirectStandardError = $true $pinfo.RedirectStandardOutput = $true $pinfo.UseShellExecute = $false $pinfo.Arguments = "/extract:$sp_sharepoint_extract_temp /quiet" $p = New-Object System.Diagnostics.Process $p.StartInfo = $pinfo Write-output "Start extract Sharepoint installer..." $p.Start() | Out-Null $p.WaitForExit() If($p.ExitCode -ne 0) { error_exit "Error: extract $sp_installer_file" }
## Copy the extracted SP installer to $sp_sharepoint_files_location Write-Output "Copy the extracted SP files to $sp_sharepoint_files_location" Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_sharepoint_extract_temp\*" -Destination "$sp_sharepoint_files_location" Remove-Item -Recurse -Force "$sp_sharepoint_extract_temp" Write-output "Finished extract SharePoint installer."
# COPY PSEXEC PACKAGE TO AUTOSPINSTALLER BIN FOLDER $psexec_file=$psexec_url.Split('/')[-1] Write-Output "Copy the PsExec package to $sp_install_bin." Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_download_location\$psexec_file" -Destination "$sp_install_bin" check_error "ERROR:WHILE COPYING THE PSEXEC PACKAGE TO $sp_install_bin." Write-output "Finished copying the PsExec package to $sp_install_bin."
# COPY ADOBE PACKAGE TO SP INSTALL ROOT $pdf_file=$adobe_pdf_iFiler_url.Split('/')[-1] $icon_file=$adobe_pdf_icon_url.Split('/')[-1] Write-Output "Copy adobe package to SP installer root..." Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_download_location\$pdf_file" -Destination "$sp_install_location\PDF" Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_download_location\$icon_file" -Destination "$sp_install_location\PDF" Write-Output "Done."
# Copy the prerequisite installer files for SharePoint Server installation to the bin folder Write-Output "Copy prerequisite installer files for SharePoint Server installation to $sp_sharepoint_files_location\PrerequisiteInstallerFiles..." Copy-Item -Force -Recurse "$sp_predownload_location\PrerequisiteInstallerFiles\*" -Destination "$sp_sharepoint_files_location\PrerequisiteInstallerFiles" Write-Output "Done."

New: Random name of DB prefix Enterprise Version of SharePoint Server 2010 to demonstrate how to set up a multi-server SharePoint farm.
The Prerequisites: - Software: 1. only works with CodePlex.com
Pre-set in the template: - OS: Windows 2008 Server R2 (Enterprise edition) - proxy settings is set if it is needed for the servers to communicate with outside. - Including .exe files to low file types is preset in the template to turn off warning for the installation.

The Prerequisites: - Software: 1. only works with CodePlex.com
Pre-set in the template: - OS: Windows 2008 Server R2 (Enterprise edition) - proxy settings is set if it is needed for the servers to communicate with outside. - Including .exe files to low file types is preset in the template to turn off warning for the installation.

ns7:component-version-script.script:
# - Configure AutoSPInstaller.xml # - Configure Sharepoint config.xml and OWA xml # # Required properties: # - domain_account # - domain_password # - sp_install_root # - sp_download_location # - sp_cust_autoSPInstaller_xml # - db_instance # - db_port # - db_prefix # - sp_admin_host # - sp_admin_cluster_hosts # - sp_appserver_cluster_hosts # - portal_app_port # - user_full_domain: for example, "domain.com" ##################################################################
$sp_install_location="$sp_install_root\SP" $sp_script_location="$sp_install_location\AutoSPInstaller" $sp_config_xml="$sp_script_location\config.xml" $sp_config_owa_xml="$sp_script_location\config-OWA.xml" $sp_script_xml="$sp_script_location\AutoSPInstallerInput.xml"
# $user_full_domain needs to be in the domain full name, for example, "domain.com" $computer_name="$ENV:COMPUTERNAME" $user_domain="$user_full_domain" $sp_admin=$sp_admin_host $unique_db_prefix="$db_prefix" $wfe_cluster=Write-Output ($sp_wfe_cluster_hosts -join ' ') # Note: For now, only one app server works with the scripts. More code to be continued. $first_node_app_server=Write-Output ($sp_appserver_cluster_hosts -join ' ')
# domain name and user name $domain,$domain_username = $domain_account -Split "\\"
#-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- # The following will configure AutoSPInstallerInput.xml, which is the central configuration # file to configure the whole SharePoint Server cluster installation. # # The following are the default values for the properties in AutoSPInstallerInput.xml. # If you follow the setup instruction for the installation, you don't need to change anything # below; Otherwise feel free to make any modification. # # There are some key props which are already exposed on the servcie property list. # The following can be optionally push to there too according to the requirements #--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# passphrase for joining the existing farm. $passphrase="vmware123#" # Default password for all installation accounts. Modify it if your setup is differenct. $install_account_allInOne_password="$allInOne_password"
# Installation accounts for SharePoint Server cluster installation $sp_install="$domain\SP_Install" $sp_farm="$domain\SP_Farm " $sp_portalAppPool="$domain\SP_PortalAppPool" $sp_ProfilesAppPool="$domain\SP_ProfilesAppPool" $sp_services="$domain\SP_Services" $sp_searchService="$domain\SP_SearchService" $sp_SearchContent="$domain\SP_SearchContent" $sp_ProfileSync="$domain\SP_ProfileSync" $sp_cacheSuperUser="$sp_services" $sp_cacheSuperReader="$sp_services"
$sp_install_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_farm_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_portalAppPool_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_ProfilesAppPool_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_services_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_searchService_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_SearchContent_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_ProfileSync_pd="$install_account_allInOne_password" $sp_cacheSuperUser_pd="$sp_services_pd" $sp_cacheSuperReader_pd="$sp_services_pd"
# Properties for Services section configures the core service instances & components that # are part of SharePoint Foundation $smtp_server="smtp.sample.com" $email_address="nobody@sample.com" $reply_to_email="nobody@sample.com" #--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# HELP FUNCTIONS Function CreateDir([string]$dirName) { If (!(Test-Path "$dirName" -Verbose)) { Write-Output "create download directory $dirName" New-Item -ItemType Directory $dirName -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue } }
Function DeleteAndCreateFile([string]$filePath) { If (Test-Path "$filePath" -Verbose) { Remove-Item -Force $filePath }
$path = split-path $filePath -Parent $fileName = split-path $filePath -Leaf
CreateDir $path
write-Output "create download directory $fileName" New-Item -ItemType File $filePath -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue }
Set-ExecutionPolicy remoteSigned -Force
## GENERATE CONFIG FILE FOR SHAREPOINT SETUP DeleteAndCreateFile $sp_config_xml DeleteAndCreateFile $sp_config_owa_xml Write-Output "Compose config.xml for Sharepoint setup" add-content $sp_config_xml "<Configuration>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Package Id=`"sts`">" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"LAUNCHEDFROMSETUPSTS`" Value=`"Yes`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " </Package>" add-content $sp_config_xml "" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Package Id=`"spswfe`">" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUPCALLED`" Value=`"1`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"OFFICESERVERPREMIUM`" Value=`"1`" />" add-content $sp_config_xml " </Package>" add-content $sp_config_xml "" add-content $sp_config_xml " <ARP ARPCOMMENTS=`"Installed with AutoSPInstaller (http://autospinstaller.com)`" ARPCONTACT=`"brian@autospinstaller.com`" />" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Logging Type=`"verbose`" Path=`"%temp%`" Template=`"SharePoint Server Setup(*).log`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Display Level=`"basic`" CompletionNotice=`"No`" AcceptEula=`"Yes`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <INSTALLLOCATION Value=`"%PROGRAMFILES%\Microsoft Office Servers\`" />" add-content $sp_config_xml " <PIDKEY Value=`"$pidkey`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"SERVERROLE`" Value=`"APPLICATION`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"USINGUIINSTALLMODE`" Value=`"1`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUPTYPE`" Value=`"CLEAN_INSTALL`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUP_REBOOT`" Value=`"Never`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml " <Setting Id=`"AllowWindowsClientInstall`" Value=`"True`"/>" add-content $sp_config_xml "</Configuration>" Write-Output "Finished config.xml for Sharepoint setup"
Write-Output "Compose config-OWA.xml for Sharepoint setup" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml "<Configuration>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Package Id=`"sts`">" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"LAUNCHEDFROMSETUPSTS`" Value=`"Yes`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " </Package>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml "" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Logging Type=`"verbose`" Path=`"%temp%`" Template=`"Wac Server Setup(*).log`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Display Level=`"basic`" CompletionNotice=`"no`" />" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"SERVERROLE`" Value=`"APPLICATION`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <PIDKEY Value=`"$pidkey`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"USINGUIINSTALLMODE`" Value=`"1`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUPTYPE`" Value=`"CLEAN_INSTALL`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"SETUP_REBOOT`" Value=`"Never`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml " <Setting Id=`"AllowWindowsClientInstall`" Value=`"True`"/>" add-content $sp_config_owa_xml "</Configuration>" Write-Output "Finished config-OWA.xml for Sharepoint setup"
Write-Output "Start to compose the SP installation configuration xml file" [xml]$xmlInput=(Get-Content $sp_script_xml)
# Configure Install options $xmlInput.Configuration.Install.OfflineInstall="true" $xmlInput.Configuration.Install.AutoAdminLogon.Enable="true" $xmlInput.Configuration.Install.AutoAdminLogon.Password="$admin_password" $xmlInput.Configuration.Install.Disable.LoopbackCheck="false"
# Write install-central-admin to admin server $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.PassPhrase="$passphrase" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.CentralAdmin.Provision="$sp_admin $wfe_cluster" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.CentralAdmin.Database="AdminContent-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.CentralAdmin.Port="$sp_admin_port"
# and set the VMs that Central Admin, web apps, and web servers will be installed to Write-Output "Set DB instance information." $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Database.DBServer="SP2010CLUSTERDB-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Database.DBAlias.DBInstance="$db_instance" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Database.DBAlias.DBPort="$db_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Database.DBPrefix="$unique_db_prefix"
# Configure Services section configures the core service instances & components that are part of SharePoint Foundation. # Installing STMP and configuration of email service is off. You can turn them on if desired $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Services.SMTP.Install="false" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Services.OutgoingEmail.SMTPServer="$smtp_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Services.OutgoingEmail.EmailAddress="$email_address" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Services.OutgoingEmail.ReplyToEmail="$reply_to_email"
# Configure WebApplications session $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.AddURLsToHOSTS="false" # Web application "portal" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].url="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].port="$portal_app_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].databaseName="PortalDB-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].applicationPoolAccount="$sp_portalAppPool" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.owner="$sp_portalAppPool" if( "$portal_app_port" -eq "80" ) { $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.siteUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.SearchUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain/search" } else { $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.siteUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain"+":"+"$web_app_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[0].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.SearchUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain"+":"+"$web_app_port/search" }
# Web application "mySiteHost" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].url="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].port="$web_app_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].name="MySiteHost-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].databaseName="MySiteHostDB-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.name="MySiteHost-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].applicationPoolAccount="$sp_ProfilesAppPool" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.owner="$sp_ProfilesAppPool" if( "$web_app_port" -eq "80" ) { $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.siteUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.SearchUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain/search" } else { $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.siteUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain"+":"+"$web_app_port" $xmlInput.Configuration.WebApplications.WebApplication[1].SiteCollections.SiteCollection.SearchUrl="http://$sp_admin.$user_domain"+":"+"$web_app_port/search" }
# Configure ServiceApps session $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.ManagedMetadataServiceApp.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.UserProfileServiceApp.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.CrawlServers.Server.Name="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.QueryServers.Server.Name="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.SearchQueryAndSiteSettingsServers.Server.Name="$first_node_app_server" # Note: You can only run the AdminComponent on one server per Search Service App, so only list one server here $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.AdminComponent.Server.Name="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.AdminComponent.ApplicationPool.Account="$sp_searchService" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.DatabaseName="Search-$unique_db_prefix" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.StateService.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.WebAnalyticsService.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.SPUsageService.Provision="$first_node_app_server" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.SecureStoreService.Provision="$first_node_app_server"
# Configure installation accounts in the configuration file $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Account.Username="$sp_install" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.Account.Password="$sp_install_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[0].CommonName="spservice" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[0].Username="$sp_services" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[0].Password="$sp_services_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[1].CommonName="portalapppool" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[1].Username="$sp_portalAppPool" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[1].Password="$sp_portalAppPool_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[2].CommonName="mysiteapppool" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[2].Username="$sp_ProfilesAppPool" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[2].Password="$sp_ProfilesAppPool_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[3].CommonName="searchservice" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[3].Username="$sp_searchService" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ManagedAccounts.ManagedAccount[3].Password="$sp_searchService_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ObjectCacheAccounts.SuperUser="$sp_cacheSuperUser" $xmlInput.Configuration.Farm.ObjectCacheAccounts.SuperReader="$sp_cacheSuperReader"
$xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.UserProfileServiceApp.SyncConnectionAccount="$sp_ProfileSync" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.UserProfileServiceApp.SyncConnectionAccountPassword="$sp_ProfileSync_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.Account="$sp_searchService" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.Password="$sp_searchService_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.ContentAccessAccount="$sp_SearchContent" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.ContentAccessAccountPassword="$sp_SearchContent_pd"
$xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.ApplicationPool.Account="$sp_SearchContent" $xmlInput.Configuration.ServiceApps.EnterpriseSearchService.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplications.EnterpriseSearchServiceApplication.ApplicationPool.Password="$sp_SearchContent_pd"
# Done all the modification in the configuration file. Save it. $sp_script_xmlfile=Get-Item "$sp_script_xml" if ($sp_script_xmlfile.IsReadOnly -eq $true) { # take off ReadOnly mode $sp_script_xmlfile.IsReadOnly=$false $xmlInput.Save($sp_script_xml) # Put back ReadOnly mode $sp_script_xmlfile.IsReadOnly=$true } else { $xmlInput.Save($sp_script_xml) } Write-Output "Customization of xml input file is done."
